rundown: 4-3 W @ New York Mets Bryce Elder: 7.0 innings, 2 earned runs, 5 hits, 1 HR, 6 strikeouts Batters: Ozzie Albies (3 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 3 RBI) Michael Harris II (3 hits - 4 AB, 1 RBI) The Braves secured a narrow victory against the New York Mets, showcasing a strong offensive performance led by Ozzie Albies. Key highlights include Albies' standout game with three hits, including a home run and three RBIs, which were crucial in driving the team's runs. Bryce Elder delivered a solid pitching performance, allowing only two earned runs over seven innings. Michael Harris II also contributed significantly with three hits and an RBI, helping the Braves maintain their lead. The combination of effective pitching and timely hitting was the key to the Braves' success in this matchup.
